children.subject: Yeah I would take 186, from what I've heard its one of the most useful classes if you choose to go into software engineering. Its also on the lighter side of CS upper-div rigor. From what I've heard, 61C isn't necessary (search this piazza, there are multiple accounts of people excelling in the class without it). Plus, in your case, you'll be taking 186 WITH CS61C so your situation is even more ideal. I'm pretty sure 61B is listed as a prereq because the class utilizes Java, so I imagine you'd be fine as long as you know Java syntax -- but don't quote me on that.

188 sounds like the best balance for me, but everyone is telling me 186 or Data 100 is better for software internships.  But you're right, 3.5 project heavy classes is probably a bad recipe (I think STAT 140 is half project/half pset based since there's a lab to the class now).  I do need to take all 3 (100/186/188) at some point though.  I really wonder if Data 100 has gotten a lot more complex and project heavy, I've heard lots of rumors about that.

For 186: 61C is helpful for learning how databases work but not necessary. I would say 61B is pretty important for the projects because you're basically implementing a dbms, which involves implementing both data structures and certain algorithms. You should be okay if you did well in CC.

Other than that I would consider 188, which is also lower workload but with slightly more math. It might be a better balance with your current courses since 61B/C are both project heavy, while 188 is more problem-set based.
61B with Hilfinger has very time-consuming projects...

history.content:
so upset, my CogSci 131 class just got cancelled, so looking for an easier 4th class workload-wise. Preferably an upper division CS class, or some highly related allied field that I can realistically get into for Phase 2. Done with all breadths and all other lower division. I am declared CS FWIW, rising 2nd year student.  I currently have STAT 140 and CS61C, and am pretty committed to (re)taking CS61B with Hilfinger even though I don't need to since I took Data Structures at a CCC while in HS and that was a pretty solid class.  I know these 3 will take up a lot of time, even if some of the material is "only" average in complexity.

My default choice is Data 100 (already registered) but even though the material probably is pretty handleable, I've heard that it's quite time consuming and I was planning on moving that over for Spring semester.  How about W186?  188? 161?  W186 would not be bad actually, except that I'm not sure how much 61B and 61C is needed.
history.subject: please suggest a good 4th class
